etymology.description: 等(等) (děng, "wait") + 着(著) (zhe, "continuous aspect particle") = to be in a state of waiting
etymology.interpretation: 等(等) (děng, "wait") signifies the action of waiting, and 着(著) (zhe, "continuous aspect particle") indicates a continuous or ongoing action. Together, 等着(等著) (děng zhe) describes the action of waiting in progress, emphasizing an ongoing state of anticipation or expectancy.

examples.chinese: 妈妈在门口等着(媽媽在門口等著)。
examples.english: Mom is waiting at the door.

examples.chinese: 我们等着(我們等著)，你快点来(你快點來)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen děng zhe, nǐ kuài diǎn lái.

examples.chinese: 他在车站等着(他在車站等著)，期待火车到来(期待火車到來)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài chēzhàn děng zhe, qídài huǒchē dàolái.
examples.english: He is waiting at the station, expecting the train to arrive.
